entry.title: Ishūretsuzō (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the painted portrait series Ishūretsuzō features Ainu chieftains (example pictured) in Qing robes, Russian military coats, and as an "Ininkari bear" (white brown bear)?

entry.title: Jo Ann Evansgardner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Jo Ann Evansgardner ran for a position on the Pittsburgh City Council, she asked voters to "put this woman in her place"?

entry.title: Enkeli-Elisa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Enkeli-Elisa story about a 15-year-old girl who committed suicide because she had been bullied at school was investigated as a fraud by the police?

entry.title: Artie Belle McGinty (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 1920s and 1930s radio show actress Artie Belle McGinty played the original radio advertisement voice for Aunt Jemima?

entry.title: discrimination based on nationality (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that discrimination based on nationality is an exception to anti-discrimination laws in many countries?

entry.title: Richard Lorenz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that artist Richard Lorenz was nearly killed by a falling tree cut down by workers he had been sketching?

entry.title: Black Krrsantan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a reviewer called Black Krrsantan one of "the scariest characters in Star Wars history"?

entry.title: To Be Loved (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Adele decided never to perform "To Be Loved" live as it upset her to the point of having to leave the room?
